name: Data
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Data
description:
Data

Represents Table Data as a list of name/value pairs (hashes.) Also contains metadata such as etag and total, and provides access to the schema of the table from which the data was read.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
table = dataset.table "my_table"

data = table.data
puts "#{data.count} of #{data.total}"
if data.next?
  next_data = data.next
end

methods.name: kind
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Data#kind
methods.description: The resource type of the API response.

methods.name: etag
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Data#etag
methods.description: An ETag hash for the page of results represented by the data instance.

methods.name: token
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Data#token
methods.description: A token used for paging results. Used by the data instance to retrieve subsequent pages. See #next.

methods.name: total
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Data#total
methods.description: The total number of rows in the complete table.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
table = dataset.table "my_table"

data = table.data
puts "#{data.count} of #{data.total}"
if data.next?
  next_data = data.next
end

methods.name: schema
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Data#schema
methods.description:
The schema of the table from which the data was read.

The returned object is frozen and changes are not allowed. Use Table#schema to update the schema.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
table = dataset.table "my_table"

data = table.data

schema = data.schema
field = schema.field "name"
field.required? #=> true

methods.name: fields
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Data#fields
methods.description: The fields of the data, obtained from the schema of the table from which the data was read.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
table = dataset.table "my_table"

data = table.data

data.fields.each do |field|
  puts field.name
end

methods.name: headers
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Data#headers
methods.description: The names of the columns in the data, obtained from the schema of the table from which the data was read.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
table = dataset.table "my_table"

data = table.data

data.headers.each do |header|
  puts header
end

methods.name: next?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Data#next?
methods.description: Whether there is a next page of data.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
table = dataset.table "my_table"

data = table.data
if data.next?
  next_data = data.next
end

returns.description: true when there is a next page, false otherwise.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
table = dataset.table "my_table"

data = table.data
if data.next?
  next_data = data.next
end

returns.description: A new instance providing the next page of data.

methods.name: all
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
Data#all
methods.description:
Retrieves all rows by repeatedly loading #next until #next? returns false. Calls the given block once for each row, which is passed as the parameter.

An enumerator is returned if no block is given.

This method may make several API calls until all rows are retrieved. Be sure to use as narrow a search criteria as possible. Please use with caution.

examples.caption: Iterating each rows by passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
table = dataset.table "my_table"

table.data.all do |row|
  puts row[:word]
end

examples.caption: Using the enumerator by not passing a block:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
table = dataset.table "my_table"

words = table.data.all.map do |row|
  row[:word]
end

examples.caption: Limit the number of API calls made:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
table = dataset.table "my_table"

table.data.all(request_limit: 10) do |row|
  puts row[:word]
end

params.name: request_limit
params.description:
The upper limit of API requests to make
to load all data. Default is no limit.

params.name: yield
params.description: The block for accessing each row of data.

returns.description:
An enumerator providing access to all of the
data.
